revised_title: Growth Cycle Analysis of Nucleic Acid and Protein Content in Bacteria
tldr: The study investigates the variations in nucleic acid and protein content during the growth cycles of Pseudomonas fluorescens, Methanomonas methanica, and a sporing bacillus. The DNA mass remains relatively constant during most of the growth cycle, while the cell size and RNA mass show significant changes. The findings support the greater constancy of DNA mass and provide insights into the bacterial growth process.
